definition: to dither/to hesitate/to pace back and forth/by ext. to hover around/to linger
see 徘徊[pai2 huai2], to dither/to hesitate/to pace back and forth/irresolute

sentences.english: He fluctuated between hopes and fears.
sentences.chinese: 他在希望和恐惧中徘徊。

sentences.english: Do you find yourself floundering about aimlessly in life ?
sentences.chinese: 你会发现自己上徘徊约漫无目的地在人生？

sentences.english: Is it harmful to our psyches to wallow in sadness?
sentences.chinese: 徘徊于悲哀之中对我们的灵魂是一种伤害吗？

sentences.english: Only empty heads and empty hearts can do that.
sentences.chinese: 让人逡巡徘徊的只能是思想空洞和心灵空虚。

sentences.english: Autumn, Sassou feeling hovering between the people and things.
sentences.chinese: 入秋，飒爽的感觉徘徊在人和物之间。

sentences.english: My mind is seduced into lingering in spaces between the real and the imagined.
sentences.chinese: 我的思维被引领者进入真实与幻想的空间之间徘徊。

sentences.english: Those who are afraid of climbing the peak, forever wandering down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 害怕攀登高峰的人，永远在山下徘徊。

sentences.english: I linger in front of an immigration officer with a sycophantic look on my face.
sentences.chinese: 我带着谄媚的表情在一间入境办公室门前徘徊着。

sentences.english: Two suspicious-looking fellows were seen hanging around the campus .
sentences.chinese: 昨夜有人看见两个形迹可疑的人在校园徘徊。

sentences.english: Your shadow lingers unfeelingly at my side.
sentences.chinese: 你的影子无情在身边徘徊。

sentences.english: I wondered if I hadn’t been worshipping around the edges.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，自己是否一直徘徊在信仰的边缘。

sentences.english: They were lost and stranded by this storm.
sentences.chinese: 它们因大雪迷失了方向而在此徘徊。

sentences.english: He is teetering on the edge of catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 他在大灾难的边缘徘徊。

sentences.english: She linger outside the theater to waylay him after the show.
sentences.chinese: 徘徊想在演出之后拦住他说话。

sentences.english: Missing gnaws the pain to hold one kind inexplicably to pace back and forth innocently in my side.
sentences.chinese: 思念啃着痛含着一种莫名的无辜在我身边徘徊着。

sentences.english: Well, this guy tries to wander into the library.
sentences.chinese: 这家伙想徘徊到图书管里。

definition: to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
variant of 踟躕|踟蹰[chi2 chu2]
to tread/to tramp/to loiter/to hover around
to pace back and forth/to hesitate/to be indecisive
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
to pace/to linger/to stay over/to spiral/to hover
to wait and see/to watch from the sidelines/to look around/to survey
to sink into (vice, depravity etc)/to pass into oblivion/downfall/passing
